page.title: 10MODEL YACHTS
page.content: Every{Boxing Day}and at{Eastertide}the starter's gun is heard firing over {Roos Loch. }It signals the start of the races between model yachts at the {St.Colm's Regatta}.It's well supported with 6{"10-rater"}yachts and 7{"5- {rater"}yachts.Rater signifies the tonnage of the yacht,scaled down to model size.The winter regatta is held on{Boxing Day. The{St.Colms yacht club}is the only one left on the island.It is the second oldest organisation on the island,having been formed in{1922. As for the races themselves,there are 5 rater,10 rater,juniors and allcomers races and the best racing conditions are dry,moderately breezy days. On{Boxing Day}it is followed by a traditional Scottish dance,which is always a popular event here.
